bug.short_desc: Make 'background-position' usable for background decorator together with AlphaImageLoader

long_desc.thetext:
This is bug report continues the work of Bug #5857.
From a comment of Bug #5857 by Katja Deutschmann:
--snip-- However it would be very helpful if Qooxdoo would make it possible to use background-position for background-images filtered with AlphaImageLoader. As far as I know the AlphaImageLoader internally converts the background-image into a "normal" image. Qooxdoo nearly positions everythings absolute and puts it into divs so why not creating an extra div, setting the background-image to that div, filter the background-image and position the wrapper div with the position settings made originally for the background-image. You'll find a few workarounds with google, but I think that one was common practise some years ago when everyone had to handle IE6.
This problem is really annoying as you cannot even position an image simply on the right side or at the bottom of somethings or even use "normal" sprites. That leads to long-winded workarounds with a lot more images and rows of code for things that are so easy with background-positioning. --snip--
